intro: Bathmium villosum, commonly known as the hairy bathmium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, typical of the daisy family. Bathmium villosum thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas.
